description: UMD 4.5.0 is a minor update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.5.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (https://ggus.eu/) to make a report.
knownIssues: Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.5.0 for known issues.
changeLog: This release contains the following:<br><br>* SL6<br><ul><li>APEL 1.5.1</li><li>APEL-SSM 2.1.7</li><li>CVMFS 2.3.5</li><li>DynaFed 1.3.1</li><li>ARC 15.03.14</li><li>Globus GridFTP 11.8.4</li><li>dpm-dsi 1.9.13</li><li>Davix 0.6.6</li><li>dmlite 0.8.6</li><li>gfal2-utils 1.5.0</li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.24-3.1</li><li>ARC nagios-probes 1.9.1</li><li>QCG Broker 4.2.0</li><li>gfal2-python 1.9.2</li><li>XROOTD 4.6.1</li><li>dCache 3.0.25</li><li>FTS 3.6.8</li><li>lcgdm 0.18.2</li><li>gfal2 2.13.4</li></ul><br>* CentOS7<br><ul><li>APEL 1.5.1</li><li>APEL-SSM 2.1.7</li><li>CVMFS 2.3.5</li><li>WN 4.0.5</li><li>DynaFed 1.3.1</li><li>ARC 15.03.14</li><li>Globus GridFTP 11.8.4</li><li>dpm-dsi 1.9.13</li><li>Davix 0.6.6</li><li>dmlite 0.8.6</li><li>gfal2-utils 1.5.0</li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.24-3.1</li><li>ARC nagios-probes 1.9.1</li><li>QCG Broker 4.2.0</li><li>gfal2-python 1.9.2</li><li>XROOTD 4.6.1</li><li>dCache 3.0.25</li><li>ARGUS 1.7.3</li><li>lcgdm 0.18.2</li><li>gfal2 2.13.4</li></ul>

products.name: apel.apel-ssm
products.description: Secure Stomp Messenger (SSM) is designed to simply send messages using the STOMP protocol. Messages are signed and may be encrypted during transit. Persistent queues should be used to guarantee delivery.
products.releaseNotes: Added a delay when receiver is reconnecting to improve reliability. Improved the log output for SSM receivers so that there are fewer trivial entries and so it's more useful in tracking messages on the filesystem.

products.name: apel.apel
products.description: The APEL project provides grid accounting for EGI. It is written in Python and uses MySQL.

products.name: arc.arc-nagios-probes
products.description:
The Advanced Resource Connector (ARC) middleware is an Open Source software
solution to enable distributed computing infrastructures with the emphasis
on processing large volumes of data. ARC provides an abstraction layer over
computational resources, complete with input and output data movement
functionalities. The security model of ARC is identical to that of Grid
solutions, relying on delegation of user credentials and the concept of
Virtual Organisations. ARC also provides client tools, as well as API in C++,
Python and Java

products.name: arc.arc
products.description: The Advanced Resource Connector (ARC) middleware is an Open Source software solution to enable distributed computing infrastructures with the emphasis on processing large volumes of data. ARC provides an abstraction layer over computational resources, complete with input and output data movement functionalities. The security model of ARC is identical to that of Grid solutions, relying on delegation of user credentials and the concept of Virtual Organisations. ARC also provides client tools, as well as API in C++, Python and Java

products.name: cern.davix
products.description: davix is a C++ toolkit for advanced I/O on remote resources with HTTP based protocols.

products.name: cern.dynafed
products.description: The Dynamic Federations system allows to expose via HTTP and WebDAV a very fast dynamic name space, built on the fly by merging and caching (in memory) metadata items taken from a number of (remote) endpoints.

products.name: cern.gfal2-python
products.description: https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgutil/wiki/gfal2

products.name: cern.gfal2-utils
products.description: https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgutil/wiki/gfal2

products.name: cern.lcgdm
products.description: The project name Lcgdm comes from the first Grid-related projects, and originally meant LHC Computing Grid Data Management.Nowadays the project evolved from its initial roots, and is composed by a set of sub projects facing different aspects of data management for high throughput, widely distributed computing

products.name: cern.wn
products.description: https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/LCG/EL7WNMiddleware
products.releaseNotes: first reslease of worker node for centos7.
products.changeLog: first release of worker node for centos7 with removal of non suuported clients.

products.name: cernfrontier.squid
products.description: The Frontier distributed database caching system uses a RESTful http-based protocol to distribute data queries. The LHC experiments ATLAS and CMS use it to access conditions data describing their complicated detectors, and cache the results at all the worldwide sites that process their particle collision data. This twiki site contains documentation for the software of the Frontier system that is not experiment-specific.

products.name: cernvm.cvmfs
products.description: CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way. Files and file metadata are aggressively cached and downloaded on demand. Thereby the CernVM-FS decouples the life cycle management of the application software releases from the operating system. CernVM-FS is included in CernVM, however it can also be used outside CernVM.

products.name: dcache.dcache
products.description: dCache provides system for storing and retrieving huge amounts of data, distributed among a large number of heterogenous server nodes, under a single virtual filesystem tree with a variety of standard access methods.

products.name: dpm.dmlite
products.description: DMLite is a plugin-based C++ framework that gives functionality for namespace management, pool management and i/o access.This is at the heart of the DPM, LFC and Dynamic Federations projects, together with the other DPM backends and frontends.

products.name: dpm.dpm-dsi
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: epel.xroot
products.description: http://xrootd.org/docs.html

products.name: fts3.fts3
products.description: FTS3 is the service responsible for globally distributing the majority of the LHC data across the WLCG infrastructure. Is a low level data movement service, responsible for reliable bulk transfer of files from one site to another while allowing participating sites to control the network resource usage

products.name: gfal2.gfal2
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

products.name: globus.gridftp
products.description: GridFTP provides high-performance and reliable data transport.

products.name: infn.argus
products.description: The Argus Authorization Service renders consistent authorization decisions for distributed services (e.g., user interfaces, portals, computing elements, storage elements). The service is based on the XACML standard, and uses authorization policies to determine if a user is allowed or denied to perform a certain action on a particular service
products.changeLog: The new Authentication Profile PIP, which provides support for different CA authentication profiles in Argus: The new x509-authn-profile XACML attribute, that allows to write level-of-assurance aware policies, in case you need more flexibility than what is allowed by the VO-CA-AP file first level of authorization implememented in the PEP server; The new x509-subject-issuer XACML attribute, which was introduced to simplify the development of the Authentication Profile PIP.

products.name: qcg.qcg-broker
products.description: QCG-Broker is a successor of the Grid Resource Management System (GRMS) project. QCG-Broker was designed to be an open-source meta-scheduling framework that allows developers to build and easily deploy resource management systems to control large-scale distributed computing infrastructures running queuing or batch systems locally.
